tool.name: filter samples from otu table
tool.description: Filters samples from an OTU table on the basis of the number of observations in that sample, or on the basis of sample metadata. Mapping file can also be filtered to the resulting set of sample ids.
tool.command:
filter_samples_from_otu_table.py -i $input_fp -o $output_fp #if str($mapping_fp) != 'None': -m $mapping_fp --output_mapping_fp=$output_mapping_fp #end if #if str($sample_id_fp) != 'None': --sample_id_fp=$sample_id_fp #end if
#if str($valid_states): -s $valid_states #end if
#if $min_count: -n $min_count #end if
#if $max_count: -x $max_count #end if

param.label: -i/--input_fp: the input otu table filepath in biom format
param.name: input_fp

param.label: -m/--mapping_fp: path to the map file [default: None]
param.name: mapping_fp

param.label: --sample_id_fp: Path to file listing sample ids to keep. Valid formats for the file are: 1) any white space, newline, or tab delimited list of samples, 2) a mapping file with samples in the first column [default: None]
param.name: sample_id_fp

param.label: -n/--min_count: the minimum total observation count in a sample for that sample to be retained [default: 0]
param.name: min_count

param.label: -x/--max_count: the maximum total observation count in a sample for that sample to be retained [default: infinity]
param.name: max_count
